meanings.definition: To talk or write about oneself excessively or boastfully.
meanings.sent1: She always egotized about her accomplishments during our conversations.
meanings.sent2: He egotized for hours about his new car to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent3: At the party, John egotized about his golf game, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her social media posts were egotized with photos of herself at every opportunity.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was egotized with self-praise and grandiose claims.

meanings.definition: To focus excessively on oneself or one's own interests.
meanings.sent1: She egotized on her own needs without considering others around her.
meanings.sent2: He often egotized on his personal goals without taking into account the team's objectives.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, the boss egotized on his vacation plans, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was egotized on her upcoming promotion, blocking out all other thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work was egotized on self-expression, neglecting the audience's perspective.
